Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: RowlyP
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with family. Reception was helpful enough, 24 service station next door was saviour with son coughing all night. Beds comfortable, room functional. Walls/Ceiling thin as we learnt on a Saturday night with couple 'up all night'. Was OK

Reviews.Title: “love to find these clean nice little hotels”
Reviews.Author: wicklesscandle
Reviews.Content: check in was easy, clerk was very nice. didnt really care for parking behind hotel, but was ok. hotel grounds appear to be well kept. room was more than expected, shower is dated but clean. remote on tv didn't work real well. will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect experience”
Reviews.Author: California9
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel based on location and TripAdvisor reviews. The room had a pleasant decor and was perfectly clean. The shower was exceptional. Reception staff was pleasant and efficient. What's not to like? It doesn't have an elevator to the second floor but that didn't matter to me. They gave me a choice of floors when I checked in.

Reviews.Title: “Poo-poo those bad reviews, people...”
Reviews.Author: gcmom7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I absolutely loved this hotel, for both its appearance, staff, features, and rates. The property, including the pool and area, were spotless, very clean, and had great tiles for flooriing and sidewalk areas. There was NO peeling paint, and the beds were sooooo comfortable. They were plush, the bedding was very clean and fine-lined, and each bed had 5 pillows!!. The breakfast was more than sufficient to hold one over to lunchtime, the rooms featured refrigerators, and we even were able to 'rent' a microwave from the office for just $5/day. (we had microwave popcorn we enjoyed at night.) :-) The hotel is in walking distance of lots of shopping areas, and many different types of restaurants. (We HIGHLY recommend the Sam's Philly Steak Depot nearby. Look up the address. It was plentiful, delicious, and very reasonably priced. The restaurant was very clean and decorated in the old-diner style.) This hotel is in a very safe area, too. If you are visiting the Greater Los Angeles area for any type event or trip, it is well worth your time and money to stay here. We are definitely going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Safe, and Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: adinarj
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel on a recommendation, and I'm sure glad I did! Walking distance from a shopping center with some quick and easy restaurants and very safe area. The courtyard was very pretty and pleasant. It was a comfortable and nice room. The breakfast was also good and very convenient. It's on the outskirts of the "Los Angeles" area (in San Fernando Valley) so it's less expensive, less noisy, and safer. I was very pleased with this hotel and I would definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: pasteve
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights July 5th through the 8th. Check in was smooth & quick,with requested quiet location provided, room had mini fridge I never used, king sized bed nice & firm with plenty of extra pillows. It was in the 90's during the day so I had to have the air conditioner on full blast at all times. It's dated & noisy but was able to sleep well all 3 nights. Cable TV provided but picture quality bad on dated picture tube (I'm used to HDTV!) Basic continental breakfast consists of plain bagels or toast with cream cheese & jam. Orange juice & coffee with pastries also provided. Shopping & restaurants close by including ROSS just across the street. Rate of $80 per night through Booking.com including all taxes very reasonable for the area. Only complaint was a few tine ants in the bathroom & the towels were on the thin size & no free internet service in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Textiletyke”
Reviews.Author: textiletyke
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy but quiet neighborhood and excellent parking, as far as commuting to donwntown you need a car anywhere in CA. Overall pleasant experience

Reviews.Title: “Safe and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: CAHeadHunter
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews of the Tarzana Inn my husband and I chose it for a stop over on our way to San Diego from Northern California. We often transport antique furniture and the safety of an area is important to us because of the cargo we carry. The hotel is off of the freeway, located on a main street, and backs up to a residential area. The parking area is in the back of the hotel but the management was able to give us a corner room just next to the lot. We didn't bring our trailer on this trip, but the parking area is set up so that we could have driven through it with our small trailer (8')--although we would have needed to put it in it's own parking spot. The room was good sized with in-room coffee and a refrigerator and a copy of the LA Times was delivered to our door in the morning. We were able to use the free Wi-fi without any trouble. The continental breakfast started at 6:30am and included fruit, cereal, juice, milk, and baked goods--enough to get us started for the day. The property appeared well kept and the staff was very nice. The room smelled a bit musty but overall we were very pleased and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but nice”
Reviews.Author: luv2sew
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Tarzana Inn for 2 nights. We were supposed to stay for 3, but we checked out one day early. I found the hotel online, and called to make my reservation. I was told that the rate was $99 and I would get a 10% discount for being AAA. When I got there, I was told that the rate was $109 and the AAA discount would bring it down to $99. I just checked the site again, and it is still showing up as the first rate. I was annoyed enough that when the chance came to leave a day early, I did. The room itself was nice. I must say though that it was TINY. We stayed at the St. George Inn last year, and the room was almost twice the size for less money. The amenities were nicer at the Tarzana Inn. You get more stations on the cable and the room was cleaner. If money is tight, I would recommend looking into the St. George Inn. If the difference of $10-20 isn't going to make or break your trip, and you don't mind a room the size of a micro-hotel room, then stay here. Next year when I go? I am not sure where I will stay. I am not positive if I will go back to this one though.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jewel”
Reviews.Author: SJMomOf2
Reviews.Content: Cute tiny property, really easy to drive past! We had a hard time finding the street front. (Parking is also hidden way in the back.) Very beautiful, visually appealing place for the price and location near major LA attractions. The neighborhood behind the hotel is also peaceful and quiet. The little pool was nice for a soak after a hot day. The room was small but clean, and had pleasant details and nifty toiletries. The staff were very helpful. The only drawback was an attack of ants in the bathroom, which was also poorly ventilated, but otherwise this is a nice, peaceful, inexpensive place to stay. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy, but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: TeamJK
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night here to see if we wanted to move into the Tarzana/Reseda area and make a commute to work (we didn't). It is a very clean, tidy, well maintained property, with a nice. BUT... A/C fan is very noisy, kept us up all night - needed though because the area is very HOT during the summer. Also, we asked for a crib, and they provided one, but it was not put together when we arrived and we put it together ourselves which was risky to our toddler (we didn't think to call the desk; they probably would have put it together for us). Also, in the middle of the night (4 AM) a neighboring alarm clock went off, an annoying buzzer, but the hotel was very responsive and entered the empty room and turned off the alarm within minutes. It was also disappointing that we had no bathtub in our bathroom in which to bathe our toddler, just a shower albeit with a convenient detachable shower head. Also, remember it is a motel. That means the clientele is a little on the creepy side - for instance, one guy was arguing with the desk clerk (who couldn't have been nicer) over $20 on the room rate - and then proceeded to pull out a wad of hundreds. Another guy was, shall we say, robustly tattooed with a particular hate group on his arms. (He also had keys to a Ferrari - and there was one parked in the lot....) But there were no problems during our one night sojourn there. All in all - if you need a motel in the area, it's exceptionally clean, and actually a little cute. But loud.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: pntpants
Reviews.Content: Very nice garden motel; friendly staff; very clean room; great shower; great TV; walls may be a bit thin or else those people down the way were really noisy (at 7am!)...

Reviews.Title: “Good find!”
Reviews.Author: pacifico
Reviews.Content: Traveling north from San Diego toward Pismo Beach, we wanted an easy stop where we could be north of downtown LA, but spend part of the next day at the Getty Museum. We made last minute reservations at the Tarzana Inn in Tarzana, just off Hwy 101. Though we arrived late in the evening and left late the next morning, we wished we had reason to stay longer. Reasonably priced, the motel is spotless, quiet, and the staff very helpful and friendly. We stayed in many motels on this trip and the Tarzana Inn was perhaps the nicest. Our boys swam in their pool after we all enjoyed a well-stocked continental breakfast. If ever we need a stopover near LA again, weâ€™ll head here. The Getty museum is located south of Tarzana, but is not a difficult or lengthy trip. Ask the desk for easy directions.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Nice for”
Reviews.Author: JGMotek
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at this small motel, where I stayed while a family member was undergoing an operation at the nearby medical center. The room and bed were comfortable and clean, the Internet access was reliable, and there is even a coin laundry. You can grab a quick breakfast of toast and bagels in a small lounge room every morning. (Only very small complaint was a very short shower!)

Reviews.Title: “Just Right”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with this Days Inn. the service was great and the free breakfast was just right!! we will definetly stay at this Inn again.

HotelInfo.Name: Tarzana Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 19170 Ventura Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 91356 (Formerly Days Inn Tarzana)
